alert.note: Alert for Chester; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:56PM EST until December 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Norristown affecting Philadelphia, Chester and Montgomery Counties. For the Schuylkill River...including Norristown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Norristown. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Flooding occurs in West Norriton. The West Indian Lane bridge begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water begins to cover and close Riverview Boulevard in West Norriton. At 15.0 feet, River Road in West Conshohocken begins to flood. The lower garages at the Riverview Landing and the Lofts at Valley Forge start to take on water. The lower section of Port Indian Road in West Norriton becomes impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EST Monday was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 9.9 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.4 feet on 03/11/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Norristown 13.0 14.1 Mon 10 p 10.6 10.0 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 700 AM EST.
